meanings.definition: The act of proving a belief or hypothesis to be false.
meanings.sent1: The disconfirmation of his theory surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The disconfirmation of the weather forecast led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The disconfirmation of the cake being delicious left everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The disconfirmation of her talent was a hard pill to swallow.
meanings.sent5: The disconfirmation of the treasure map's accuracy dashed their hopes.

meanings.definition: The state of being shown to be incorrect or untrue.
meanings.sent1: After the disconfirmation, he had to rethink his entire argument.
meanings.sent2: The disconfirmation of the rumor put an end to the gossip.
meanings.sent3: The disconfirmation of the cat's innocence made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The disconfirmation of his alibi left him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The disconfirmation of her story left a lingering doubt in their minds.
